options: Because the cyan metal cylinder did not move toward the cyan rubber sphere.
Because the yellow rubber cylinder was present.
Because the gray metal sphere collided with the cyan metal cylinder.
Because the red rubber cylinder did not collide with the cyan metal cylinder.
Because the cyan rubber sphere moved spontaneously.

If the red rubber cylinder had collided with the cyan metal cylinder, would the cyan rubber sphere still have stayed stationary?

Was the fact that the red rubber cylinder did not collide with the cyan metal cylinder sufficient for the cyan rubber sphere to stay stationary?

Was the fact that the red rubber cylinder did not collide with the cyan metal cylinder necessary for the cyan rubber sphere to stay stationary?
Was the fact that the cyan metal cylinder did not move toward the cyan rubber sphere necessary for the cyan rubber sphere to stay stationary?

options: The yellow rubber cylinder is present.
The red rubber cylinder does not collide with the cyan metal cylinder.
The cyan metal cylinder does not move toward the cyan rubber sphere.
The gray metal sphere collides with the cyan metal cylinder and the red rubber cylinder does not collide with the cyan metal cylinder.
The gray metal sphere collides with the cyan metal cylinder.
